results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with information about Polish audiobooks and adaptations of Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" (Władca Pierścieni):

## Polish Audiobooks

The Lord of the Rings audiobooks are available in Polish with narration by Marian Czarkowski. All three volumes are published by MUZA S.A. and available on Audioteka. The audiobook production has been praised for its exceptional quality, with Czarkowski's performance bringing listeners into Middle-earth and giving each scene new dimension.

The audiobooks include:
- The Fellowship of the Ring (Drużyna Pierścienia) - Volume 1
- The Two Towers (Dwie wieże) - Volume 2
- Complete trilogy (Tom I-III)(no content)The audiobooks are recorded in high quality with attention to sound clarity and appropriate narrative pacing, with professional production making listening a true pleasure.

The audiobooks use Maria Skibniewska's Polish translation, which is the standard Polish version of Tolkien's work.

## Polish Dubbing and Radio Adaptations

There was a Polish dubbing of Ralph Bakshi's 1978 animated "The Lord of the Rings" film, which was commissioned by Polish Television (Telewizja Polska) and aired exclusively on TVP stations. However, video releases and broadcasts on non-TVP channels used a narrator version instead, while DVD releases only included subtitles.

The Polish version was produced by TELEWIZYJNE STUDIA DŹWIĘKU in Warsaw, directed by Dorota Kawęcka, with dialogues based on Maria Skibniewska's translation adapted by Grażyna Dyksińska-Rogalska.

## Reception and Quality

Reviewers emphasize that the audiobook captures the unique atmosphere of Tolkien's novels, offering a much richer experience than film adaptations. The audiobooks are praised for both their content and excellent narrator performance, as highlighted in enthusiastic listener reviews.

While some listeners note that the narrator could occasionally be more serious, he excellently captures the spirit of the story, allowing listeners to forget about everyday life.

The Polish audiobooks appear to be the primary professional audio adaptation available, with Marian Czarkowski's narration being particularly well-regarded by Polish audiences.
